com.opentok.android
Class Publisher

java.lang.Object
  com.opentok.android.Publisher

public abstract class Publisher
extends java.lang.Object

A publisher captures an audio-video stream from the device's microphone and camera. Create a Publisher instance by calling the Publisher.newInstance() static method.

When the view of a Publisher leaves the active window, the Publisher object is destroyed. This is the case for an activity that is stopped or paused. Also, you should disconnect a session when its activity is stopped or paused due to the app becoming inactive (going into the background). You can then reconnect when the activity resumes. (See the Session.connect() and Session.disconnect() methods.) When the activity resumes and the window is active, you can create a new Publisher object and publish to the session.

          Monitors state changes in a Publisher object.

Method Detail

newInstance

public static Publisher newInstance(Context context)
Creates a new Publisher instance. Use the Session.publish() method to start streaming from this Publisher into a session.

The getView() method returns the android.view.View object containing the published video.

Publishers cannot be reused

When the view of a Publisher leaves the active window, the Publisher object is destroyed. This is the case for an activity that is stopped or paused. Also, you should disconnect a session when its activity is stopped or paused due to the app becoming inactive (going into the background). You can then reconnect when the activity resumes. (See the Session.connect() and Session.disconnect() methods.) When the activity resumes and the window is active, you can create a new Publisher object and publish to the session.

Parameters:
context - The android.content.Context for the Publisher.
Returns:
A new Publisher instance, or null if an error occurs.

destroy

public abstract void destroy()
Releases this object, including all hardware and UI resources bound to it.

swapCamera

public abstract void swapCamera()
Cycles between cameras, if there are multiple cameras on the device. When the camera used by the Publisher changes, the Publisher.Listener.onPublisherChangedCamera(int) method is called.

setCameraId

public abstract boolean setCameraId(int cameraId)
Set the desired camera. cameraId can be a value between 0 and Camera#getNumberOfCameras() - 1.

When the camera used by the Publisher changes, the Publisher.Listener.onPublisherChangedCamera(int) method is called.

Parameters:
cameraId - the id of the camera you want to use on this publisher
Returns:
true if the change is accepted.

getCameraId

public abstract int getCameraId()
Returns the currently active camera ID. This value is either 0 (for the back-facing camera) or 1 (for the front-facing camera). If setCameraId(int) is never called, the return value is 1 (for the front-facing camera).

setListener

public void setListener(Publisher.Listener listener)
Binds a Publisher.Listener to this Publisher instance to monitor state changes.

Parameters:
listener - The Publisher.Listener that will monitor this instance, or null to disconnect a listener.

getListener

public Publisher.Listener getListener()
Returns the listener that was bound to this publisher by setListener(Listener).

Returns:
The listener bound to this publisher.

getSession

public Session getSession()
Returns the Session associated this instance.

Returns:
The Session associated this instance.

getPublishVideo

public abstract boolean getPublishVideo()
Returns true if the Publisher is publishing video; false if it is not.

getPublishAudio

public abstract boolean getPublishAudio()
Returns true if the Publisher is publishing audio; false if it is not.

setPublishVideo

public abstract void setPublishVideo(boolean publishVideo)
Whether to publish video or not. By default, streams publish both audio and video.

Parameters:
publishVideo - Whether to publish video (true) or not (false)

setPublishAudio

public abstract void setPublishAudio(boolean publishAudio)
Whether to publish audio or not. By default, streams publish both audio and video.

Parameters:
publishAudio - Whether to publish audio (true) or not (false)

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
The stream name. The name appears at the bottom of Subscriber videos.

Returns:
publisher name

setName

public abstract void setName(java.lang.String name)
Set the name for this stream. The name appears at the bottom of the publisher video and at the bottom of subscriber videos associated with the published stream. You can set this name after initializing the publisher and before sending the Publisher.Listener.onPublisherStreamingStarted() method is called. Setting the property after the Publisher.Listener.onPublisherStreamingStarted() method is called has no effect on the name displayed for the stream. The default name is "" (an empty string).

getView

public abstract View getView()
Returns the View object that contains the Publisher video.
